page.title: 19The Art Scene, Warbleton
page.content: The Art Scene in 1985 is informal but thriving. There are no organised classes but painting is a popular pastime. Once a year, as part of the Flower Show in July, The work of local amateur artists is collected and hung in the Dunn village hall. This year, some 30 men and women submitted nearly 50 paintings and drawings and 7 were sold. Knowledgeable opinion judges the work to be of good quality. The most prolific painters in the village are undoubtedly Mr and Mrs Beckley who paint in water colour and oils respectively. Their subjects are mainly landscapes and still life flower arrangements. Their studio is open to the public at weekends.
